importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Su Yiming won a gold medal in the men's big air event at the Beijing Winter Olympics just days before his 18th birthday, marking a pivotal moment in his career and public recognition.
Su Yiming switched his focus from acting to professional snowboarding in 2018, signaling the beginning of his competitive career and eventual rise to Olympic champion status.
Su Yiming is preparing for the upcoming Winter Olympics in Italy in 2025, where he aims to defend his Olympic title and face increased pressure as a global snowboarding superstar.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2018 to 2022 marks Su Yiming’s transition from child actor to elite snowboarder, culminating in his Olympic medal wins at the 2022 Beijing Winter Games.

keyTakeAways: Su Yiming, a Chinese snowboarder, won gold in the men’s big air event at the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics, becoming a national and international sensation.
Prior to snowboarding, Su gained fame as a child actor in films like 'The Taking of Tiger Mountain', which helped build his public profile in China.
Su’s parents were both snowboarders, and he began playing on the slopes at age four, developing a lifelong passion for the sport.
After winning Olympic medals, Su took a year and a half off to recover mentally and physically, emphasizing the importance of rest and balance in elite sports.
Su has become a multi-faceted public figure, with a strong presence on social media (over 300,000 followers on Instagram and over 2 million on Weibo), and partnerships with luxury brands.
He maintains a balanced lifestyle involving family time, outdoor activities like fishing, pool, and surfing, and remains grounded despite his rising fame.
Su’s journey reflects the broader global trend of young athletes using their success to inspire youth, blending sport, media, and lifestyle culture.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Su Yiming, a Chinese snowboarder who began as a child actor in films like 'The Taking of Tiger Mountain,' transitioned to professional snowboarding in 2018. At the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics, he won a gold medal in the men's big air event and a silver in slopestyle, capturing national and international attention. His success led to widespread media coverage, brand partnerships, and a massive social media presence, with over 300,000 followers on Instagram and over 2 million on Weibo. After the Olympics, he took a year and a half off to recover mentally and physically, emphasizing balance, nature, and family life. Now preparing for the 2025 Winter Olympics in Italy, Su is facing increased pressure as a rising global sports star, but remains grounded by his roots and commitment to personal growth and youth inspiration.
title: From child actor to Olympic champion: Meet snowboarding superstar Su Yiming
